thread.title: This Seriously Delicious Homemade Granola Recipe Isn't Just for Hippies
thread.title_full: This Seriously Delicious Homemade Granola Recipe Isn't Just for Hippies

author: Munchies Staff
title: This Seriously Delicious Homemade Granola Recipe Isn't Just for Hippies
text:
This Seriously Delicious Homemade Granola Recipe Isn't Just for Hippies With almonds, golden raisins, dates, pecans, seeds, and plenty of spices, we promise that this is the best granola you've ever tasted. 
What are you snacking on over there? Peanut butter cups? Plastic-wrapped meat tubes? Nacho-dust-covered chips? C'mon. We're all a little older and wiser now, and it's time to get a little more "adult" with our snacking habits. 
No, we're not talking about undergarments made of fruit roll-ups. We're talking about eating like you actually give a damn what goes into the one body that your mama gave you. 
This homemade granola comes from NYC's beloved healthy-eating spot Dimes, and it's loaded with good-for-you stuff (like almonds, pumpkin seeds, pecans, coconut oil, and golden raisins) and tastes-real-good stuff (like cardamom, cinnamon, vanilla, honey, and dates). 
RECIPE: Cardamom-Spiced Granola 
And hey, no need to equate granola with patchouli and drug rugsâ€”this stuff will win over everyone. Take it on a day hike, eat a couple handfuls after your workout, or just keep a nice big bowl of it at your desk, cuz that's where the snacks attack hit the worst.
